class_notes:
This course provides an introduction to creating live, interactive, and generative music using the Max audio software. We will learn common and useful techniques and survey works written in these media, and students will then devise and create final projects, culminating in a workshop-style performance of these.
The class is aimed at composition majors, but is open to all with permission of the instructor.
Prerequisite: MUS 347 or permission of instructor.
course_description: Introduction to techniques and history of live electronic music through music coding, seminar discussion and performance. Topics include live sound engineering, synthesis, sampling, processing, algorithmic and interactive approaches, and creating performance patches.
prerequisites: MUS 347 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
